response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Sum of Odd Numbers\", \"description\": \"Write a function `sum_odd_numbers` that takes an integer `n` as input and returns the sum of all odd numbers from 1 to `n`. For example, if `n` is 10, the function should return 25 (the sum of odd numbers from 1 to 10).\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef sum_odd_numbers(n: int) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): An integer representing the upper limit.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the sum of all odd numbers from 1 to `n`.\", \"code\": \"def sum_odd_numbers(n: int) -> int:\\n    total = 0\\n    for i in range(1, n + 1):\\n        if i % 2 != 0:\\n            total += i\\n    return total\", \"tests\": [\"assert sum_odd_numbers(10) == 25\", \"assert sum_odd_numbers(20) == 100\", \"assert sum_odd_numbers(5) == 16\"] }"
